data.title: Bowling Green High School
data.meta_description: Athletics - High School - Bowling Green High School
data.text:
BGHS and Transfer Students:

1. Log into your BGCS FinalForms account to complete athletic forms

2. OHSAA Physical Form 23-24

3. Pay to Participate Policy

Homeschooled, non-public school and community school students who wish to participate in BGHS or BGMS athletics should contact:

Michele Wolf

High School Athletic Director

419-354-0100 x1003

mwolf@bgcs.k12.oh.us

As an athlete, you are not eligible to try out, practice, or participate in any interscholastic activity until the following items have been completed:

Physical examination completed and form turned into your coach (exception - Quiz Bowl)

All forms completed and signed on the FinalForms website

All academic eligibility requirements have been satisfied.

Bowling Green Schools expect everyone attending or competing in an event to display the highest standards of sportsmanship toward athletes, coaches and support staff, game officials, and fans. Please remember that you are representing both our schools and our community, so please do your part to make events safe, wholesome, and enjoyable for all in attendance.

NLL Sportsmanship Guidelines

Cheering is to be positive and respectful

Opponents and officials will be treated with courtesy and respect.

The throwing of objects or the use of noisemakers will not be tolerated.

We will be supportive in our comments and cheers the good play of all participants.

OHSAA Parents & Fans Fair Play Code

OHSAA Players & Coaches Fair Play Code

We need help! Become an OHSAA Official!

The Northern Lakes League is expanding, adding 4 schools to the league and breaking the league into 2 divisions based on enrollment.

New NLL High School Map

Buckeye Division (2023-24, 2024-25)

Whitmer - 1,620

Perrysburg - 1,278

Findlay - 1,193

Anthony Wayne - 1,067

Northview - 983

Cardinal Division (2023-24, 2024-25)

Clay - 846

Springfield - 834

Southview - 814

Fremont Ross - 800

Bowling Green - 674

Napoleon - 436

Because football schedules are developed seasons in advance, 2019-20, 2020-21, 2021-22 enrollment figures were used to develop the football divisions:

Buckeye Football Division (2023 & 2024)

Whitmer - 1,605

Perrysburg - 1,252

Findlay - 1,175

Anthony Wayne - 1,082

Northview - 1,014

Springfield - 884

Cardinal Football Division (2023 & 2024)

Fremont Ross - 853

Southview - 745

Bowling Green - 714

Napoleon - 506
